title: Riot, why does every good decision you make have to be coupled with a questionable one?

replies.body: Better question, why does everyone feel so entitled considering they are playing a free game?

I mean, it's fine if Riot doesn't want to listen to player concerns. Since this is a free game, it's actually easier to lose customers. We have nothing to lose by complaining and quitting the game. Riot has everything to lose.

It would be in Riot's interests to consider our opinions. A single player is not entitled, but the playerbase is. Riot is nothing without us.
But they gave us things like the sandbox mode and returned solo/duo queue. How is that not listening to people's opinions?
Where did I say Riot did not listen to people?
You said "It's fine if Riot doesn't want to listen to players concerns" and "it would be in riot's best interest to consider our opinions." That's literally saying that riot doesn't listen to people.

No it's not actually.

You should read everything pertaining to the comment.

> Riot, why does every good decision you make have to be coupled with a questionable one?

That's the point: they come with something good, something that people have actually ASKED FOR and then they come with something NO ONE ASKED FOR LIKE...EVER. They keep ruining things that are fine/good and things almost no one is complaining about.

It's always one or the other with them: they either come with something that players have been suggesting for ages OR they come with things no one asked for.

If they stop with the latter they will actually create a very nice game that everyone enjoys.
not neccesarily true, if you spent money then you most certainly have something to lose

This is purely in response to the first part 



People did quit the game. A fair amount of people quit this game and that  is why we are  getting solo/duo queue.
Proof? 
Riot abolishing dynamic queue as the perfect solution.

As a business, riot won't do anything unless there's something, even if it's tiny, that they will gain from it. 
Dynamic queue was an entire year of what was likely a crap tonne of money and time investments.
No sane business would flush it down the shitter just because people don't like it (I being one of them).

As pointed out earlier this year, DQ couldn't possibly function without solo players, the very players that DQ screws.
Thus, for riot to be willing to reinstate solo/duo queue.... a fairly large chunk of solo players must have either ceased ranked or quit completely.
Proof: the insane challenger level queue times in low elo DQ (the top 2% of players had better queue times than the bottom what? 80%?)

So... by reinstating solo/duo. Riot hopes to reclaim the players they have losed. More players= a larger recruitment team= more rp purchases= riot profit.

There's no way in hell riot's doing this out of the goodness of their heart ( hence why dq will still be here next season).

Riot still net-profited hard off Dynamic Queue because of people inviting their friends to play with them. It's also a good cash-grab because when people play with friends they are more likely to buy each other gifts.

Sure, people complained, most of them stayed though. Now they are expanding on the system to appeal to an even wider audience. They aren't removing Dynamic Queue, they are just reinstating the old queueing system which they couldn't do before. They couldn't do it because they thought they would lose a large player base (the people who played dynamic queue).

That was the idea. It obviously didn't pan out that way. League has been losing players slowly due to being an older game, and dynamic queue and hextech crafting was meant to fix that. Instead dynamic queue shifted it into high gear for ranked.
How do you know ppl aren't quitting?

Cause they are too busy complaining on the boards. And trust me people who care this much about the game aren't quitting any time soon. The people who quit the game are people who aren't going to make a bunch of posts on the boards. Because they aren't invested in the game enough to do that.

It's like complaining about your favourite cigarette brand on a smoking-enthusiast forum. Do you really think those guys are going to quit any time soon? (not endorsing smoking)

As a member from my group, none of us play League anymore (~20 strong) due to the changes from Season 6. However we all still talk about it. Just because we want to play League again and had fun playing it in the past doesn't mean we enjoy the current state of it. We want it to be fun again and try and present ideas that could help improve it. The real question is if Riot will implement any of them.
ikr

Posting on the boards has nothing to do with quitting?

I'm gonna say it again:

It's fine if Riot doesn't want to listen to player concerns. Since this is a free game, it's actually easier to lose customers. We have nothing to lose by complaining and quitting the game. Riot has everything to lose.

It would be in Riot's interests to consider our opinions. A single player is not entitled, but the playerbase is. Riot is nothing without us.
